intro: Capirona wurdackii, commonly known as the Wurdack's capirona, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, clustered white flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Capirona wurdackii is often found in moist, shaded understories of tropical forests.
